replies.replyComment: Mubaraka Begum thumbs up for this comment

You are right sister, but pls don't keep saying that the Muslims should understand. It's true that some Muslim leaders may be a reason for such a destruction took place in Easter April.
But, Sri Lanka was lucky that it received prior warning etc about the attack which was not known to the innocent Muslims but which was completely looked away by the Government. 
But it is unfortunate to see that the majority Sri Lankans are breaking into the businesses of Muslims not breaking into or demanding justice to what the government did. Sri Lankans need to think and understand...not just Muslims. 
In saying that, please know that I don't try to defend the Muslims...I'm only emphasising on what seems to be unfair.

And I also think Sri Lankans, particularly non Muslims should stop going to the middle eastern countries for any reason. Because, the attack on Easter only came last month after warning although there were politically created quarrels between different religions in Sri Lanka. However, Sri Lanka has been governed by Buddhist leaders who have the executive power to do anything and everything. 
But what did they do? One government eradicated the war but imprisoned the General Fonseka soon after that where his wife had to shed tears and plead in front of media to release her ill husband.
The present government made a hue and cry about the faults of the preceding government and made huge promises but hardly they are fulfilled. This is what's been happening in Sri Lanka for over 30 years. 
Why? possibly because Sri Lankans do not find the middle ground or the common ground for that matter, when taking an important decision... they fight with one political group/ colour over the other although most of the politicians have clearly showed us how dodgy and cunning they are. 
And I also read in the comments that Muslims can live in any country but where would the Sinhala Buddhists go but living in Sri Lanka. Good question from your point of view!!!
Although it's true, one thing needs to be realised that there are heaps of Sinhala Buddhists or Sinhalese people I've met and talked to abroad who live in the UK, Australia, New Zealand, and in the middle east. I've quoted some of their usual words as below which are common amongst them: "...Sri lanka is good but now we can't go. bcz of the political problems we can't do anything in there", "...I don't want to go bcz sri lankans are nosy. I don't even associate any sri lankans here", "I won't go back to Sri Lanka, bcz I've had enough and here it's good to live"
This is the love they show towards their motherland. 
There are many many Sinhalese I've met abroad compared to any Muslims from Sri Lanka. 
I studied in a Catholic school and helping at the mass and helping to decorate the statue of Jesus were things I enjoyed doing. 
I love going to the church due to the serene feeling I get when I am in church. Although we had Islam taught to us at school, I voluntarily chose to study Buddhism. I took Buddhism for OL exam and passed it. 
If you dig deep, you will find amazing people who naturally embrace the diversity of the place they were born and bred and live in. 
If you plainly observe with your own deinition of who should be what, that will blind one from seeing the reality through real eyes.
Sri Lankans should think and act on what they say. And should b just and fair in their treatment for one another. Sri Lankans need to adopt the middle ground in everything they say, think, and do. Buddhism teaches about madyama prathipadawa in many occasions, Christianity teaches about how one should show their left cheek if he was slapped on his right cheek. Islam teaches that you can retaliate only if all the options to create harmony and peace are of no avail; it means, always try and encourage forgiveness if you know by forgiving, the situation or the person is given the chance to reflect and rectify their mistakes without taking the kindness shown for granted. All in all, every religion springs from the same fountain of peace, harmony, and kindness, and compassion and love. One's actions shouldn't defy or define his religion for there is something called human conscience. 
Let's live together and die together as one and let's not seek pleasure by hurting or putting someone in trouble.

Minissunta wairaya athiwenne me desha paluwo nisa. Atha kathawa. Mata thambinwa penna ba. Namuth me kathawa ahuwama tikak anukampa hithuna.warada piliganna puluwa aya hidima sathutak.sinhalaya kupitha unoth hada naraka balanna.salakanne ekama handen. Eka hithe thiya gena wada kirima koi katath agata guani. Meka sinhala rata kiyala hithe thiyan wada karapalla. Ethakota ubala api seratama ekata eda haki. Ehema nohithana thak ubalata enna wenne bayen saken.obathuma kiyapu de kiwe hitha pathulen nam obathumata ape acharaya pitata pennana rupaya hitha athuleth thibewaaa.muslim minissu kere athiwa athi avishwasaya nathiwena andamata wada kala uththe oba thumanlai.oba thumanlage mau rate nithiyanam leyata leya pali ganimai baudda kristiyan hindu hamoma ehema hituwoth ape nathi una jivitha ganata muslimwath maranna unth obata athiwena hagima kohomada. Wairayak neda. Anna e de nowenna eda salasewa.sinhalaya nithiya athata gaththe na thama athata gath data oba thumanlata duwanna parak na.moka unath oba thumage kathawa agaya karanawa Me desha paluwo kiyana katha allah dannawanam della kapanne Ethenama .moda desha paluo pahala wenne muslim agame abagyata.thuruwan Saranai!Allah pihitai!
